item.title: Report E-2024090374
item.description:
Report E-2024090374

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:56 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of UnisolÂ® Liquid Red BK-50 released from a metal tote due to broken gasket on the tote lid. The release impacted inside of trailer #3172123. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and replaced the faulty gasket with a new one. The impacted tote body was wiped down for shipment on.

item.title: Report E-2024090318
item.description:
Report E-2024090318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 5, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of uN1824 was crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE deployed a bicarbonate/water mixture to the trailer floor to neutralize the product. Granular absorbents were deployed to retrieve all loose product, as well as the bicarbonate/water mixture. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, The damaged product container was placed into one (1) 5-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090321
item.description:
Report E-2024090321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XQC. It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of UN1263 Barn & Outbuilding Semi-Gloss Exterior Oil Bright Red was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal XCF. The release impacted trailer #3191199. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged pail and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090237
item.description:
Report E-2024090237

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:39 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XSW) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 3 gallons of G56 Hardener (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri were placed into a 30 gallon metal overpack drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

APPEARED THERE WERE NO PAINT CLIPS ON THE CANS. PACKAGE HAD NO HAZMAT MARKINGS OR LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMONDS.

item.title: Report E-2024090173
item.description:
Report E-2024090173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the printing ink-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.
